sentence.Network_en: Accuse me of being a spoilsport and I will plead guilty.
sentence.Network_cn: 说我是个让人扫兴的人,我也承认.

entry.def: If you say that someone is a spoilsport, you mean that they are behaving in a way that ruins other people's pleasure or enjoyment.

means.word_mean: 1. someone who spoils the pleasure of others

auth_sentence.content: Patricia did not want to be a spoilsport and laughed...at these antics.
auth_sentence.res_content: Patricia did not want to be a spoilsport and laughed...at these antics.
auth_sentence.res_content_con: Patricia did not want to be a spoilsport and laughed...at these antics.

auth_sentence.content: The spoilsport did not spread as much grief as he had hoped.
auth_sentence.res_content: The spoilsport did not spread as much grief as he had hoped.
auth_sentence.res_content_con: The spoilsport did not spread as much grief as he had hoped.
